.. _user_guide_interface:

Interface Overview
=================

This section provides a detailed look at the Debug Player interface and its components.

Main Window Layout
-----------------

The main window is organized into several key areas:

.. figure:: /_static/images/interface_overview.png
   :alt: Debug Player Interface Overview
   :align: center

   1. **Menu Bar** - Access to file operations, view options, and help
   2. **Toolbar** - Quick access to frequently used functions
   3. **Signal Browser** - Lists available signals and plugins
   4. **Plot Area** - Displays the selected signals
   5. **Timeline** - Navigate through the data
   6. **Status Bar** - Shows current time and status information

Menu Bar
--------

File Menu
~~~~~~~~~

- **New Session** - Start a new session (Ctrl+N)
- **Open...** - Open a data file (Ctrl+O)
- **Open Recent** - Recently opened files
- **Save Session** - Save the current session (Ctrl+S)
- **Save Session As...** - Save session with a new name
- **Export...** - Export data or plots
- **Preferences** - Configure application settings
- **Exit** - Quit the application (Ctrl+Q)

Edit Menu
~~~~~~~~~

- **Undo** - Undo the last action (Ctrl+Z)
- **Redo** - Redo the last undone action (Ctrl+Y)
- **Copy** - Copy the current selection (Ctrl+C)
- **Paste** - Paste from clipboard (Ctrl+V)
- **Delete** - Remove the selected item (Del)
- **Select All** - Select all items (Ctrl+A)
- **Find...** - Search for signals or data (Ctrl+F)

View Menu
~~~~~~~~~

- **Toolbar** - Show/hide the toolbar
- **Status Bar** - Show/hide the status bar
- **Full Screen** - Toggle full screen mode (F11)
- **Reset View** - Reset the plot view to default (0)
- **Zoom In** - Zoom in on the plot (+)
- **Zoom Out** - Zoom out from the plot (-)
- **Auto Scale** - Automatically scale the plot to fit data (A)

Tools Menu
~~~~~~~~~~

- **Signal Calculator** - Perform mathematical operations on signals
- **Filter Designer** - Design and apply filters to signals
- **Statistics** - Calculate statistics for selected signals
- **Plugin Manager** - Manage installed plugins

Window Menu
~~~~~~~~~~~

- **Cascade** - Arrange windows in a cascade
- **Tile** - Tile windows
- **Close All** - Close all open windows
- **Windows...** - List of open windows

Help Menu
~~~~~~~~~

- **Documentation** - Open the user manual (F1)
- **Examples** - Load example data
- **Check for Updates** - Check for new versions
- **About** - Show version and copyright information

Signal Browser
-------------

The signal browser displays all available signals organized by plugin. You can:

- Expand/collapse plugin nodes
- Show/hide signals by clicking the checkbox
- Right-click for signal options (properties, export, etc.)
- Drag and drop signals to reorder them
- Group signals by dragging one signal onto another

Plot Area
---------

The plot area is where your signals are visualized. You can:

- Left-click and drag to pan
- Right-click and drag to zoom
- Mouse wheel to zoom in/out
- Middle-click and drag to create a zoom rectangle
- Double-click to reset the view

Each plot can have multiple y-axes. To add a new y-axis:

1. Right-click on the plot
2. Select "Add Y Axis"
3. Assign signals to the new axis using the signal properties

Timeline
--------

The timeline at the bottom of the window shows the current position in the data and allows you to:

- Click to jump to a specific time
- Click and drag to select a time range
- Use the play/pause button to animate through the data
- Adjust the playback speed
- Set loop points for continuous playback

Status Bar
----------

The status bar at the bottom of the window shows:

- Current time in the data
- Number of selected points
- Memory usage
- Any active operations
- Error messages

Context Menus
------------

Right-clicking in different areas of the application will show context-sensitive menus with relevant options.

Signal Context Menu
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Appears when right-clicking on a signal in the signal browser:

- **Properties** - Edit signal properties
- **Show/Hide** - Toggle signal visibility
- **Export...** - Export signal data
- **Copy** - Copy signal data to clipboard
- **Delete** - Remove the signal

Plot Context Menu
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Appears when right-clicking on a plot:

- **Add Signal...** - Add a signal to the plot
- **Add Y Axis** - Add a new y-axis
- **Auto Scale** - Auto-scale the plot
- **Save Image...** - Save the plot as an image
- **Copy Image** - Copy the plot to clipboard
- **Print...** - Print the plot
- **Properties...** - Configure plot properties

Timeline Context Menu
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Appears when right-clicking on the timeline:

- **Set Start Marker** - Set the start of the selection
- **Set End Marker** - Set the end of the selection
- **Clear Selection** - Clear the current selection
- **Zoom to Selection** - Zoom to the selected range
- **Loop Selection** - Toggle looping of the selected range
- **Properties...** - Configure timeline properties
